statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Texas St. 81, Lamar 67
article.story: SAN MARCOS, Texas -- Cameron Johnson scored 19 points as Texas State defeated Lamar, 81-67, in Southland Conference pay on Saturday. With 16:10 left in the game Texas State (12-13, 6-5) had a 32-30 lead. Over the next six-minutes they would go on a 15-0 run and jump ahead 47-30. Lamar (14-12, 5-5) would never get the game back to within single digits. Ryan White added 16 points and John Bowman had 10 for the Bobcats. Anthony Miles had a game-high 23 points for the Cardinals in the loss. Kendrick Harris had 15 points. The Bobcats forced 23 turnovers, including 12 steals, which led to 22 fast break points. The Cardinals only managed nine fast break points. Lamar only made 20 of 55 (36.4 percent) from the field. This loss snaps Lamar's four-game winning streak.
